description.$t: Hi, my name is Mariah and I was found running in the rain in Bolinbrook. The nice lady who found me called Aloha rescue and they agreed to take me in. My new mom Stephanie took me to the vet to have me checked cause I had bite marks on my body and a bent tail but the vet says I am fine and only about 8 months old.I think I am a really sweet girl and I would really like the forever home that I deserve. I am great with other dogs and puppies of all sizes but I can be a little bossy till I am comfortable. If you would like to be my new home, please call Stephanie at 630-378-5311 or 630-258-9183 or you can e-mail us at pstndglass@aol.com. An application and a home visit are required. Only those within a 60 mile radius of Bolingbrook need inquire. My adoption fee of $400.00 include age appropriate shots, worming, micro-chipping, and spay.

This is Tanner. He is a 9 month old male German shepherd/boxer mix(we think).He is great with other dogs and loves cats. He is a little shy at first but warms up quickly. He is very gentle when taking treats. He is working on his housebreaking but goes on the pads if he has to. He will be a good size when fully grown and a fenced in yard would be the best. His adoption fee of $400.00 includes age appropriate shots, worming, micro-chipping, and neuter when 6 months. An application and a home visit are required. If you would like more info or an application, pls contact Stephanie at 630-378-5311 or 630-258-9183 or you can e-mail me at pstndglass@aol.com. Only those within a 60 mile radius of Bolingbrook need apply.

This is Mocha. My sons friend found her in their backyard and called Aloha. We took her right to the vet where they found she was registered to a breeder in another state that is no longer in business (thank goodness). She had a bad infection in her mouth and had to have about 11 of her teeth pulled. She was also spayed at that time so she will never have to go through pregnancy again and have her puppies taken away. Mocha is very sweet and attaches quickly and strongly to her person. She needs to go to a home that can give her the attention and love that she deserves after her previous life. She is good with other dogs but does not really play with them. She would rather be with her person. Her adoption fee of $300.00 includes her vetting up to her adoption day. Only those within  a 60 mile radius of Bolingbrook need apply. If you would like to adopt Mocha, please call Stephanie at 630-378-5311 or 630-258-9183 or you can send an e-mail to pstndglass@aol.com. An application and home visit are required.

Hi, my name is Roman and I came from a kill shelter in Mo. with my two sisters. I am a terrier mix, but don't know what kind. My parents abandoned us when we were just babies and that is how we ended up at Aloha rescue. We all really love it here, we have plenty of food and other dogs to play with but I really need a forever home so that my foster mom can save more lives like mine. My adoption fee of $400.00 includes age appropriate shots, worming, micro-chip, and my neuter (ouch) when I am 5-6 months old. If you would like more info or an application, please call Stephanie at 630-378-5311 pr 630-258-9183 or you can send an e-mail to pstndglass@aol.com.Only those within a 60 mile radius of Bolingbrook, Il. need inquire. An application and home visit are required. Hope to hear from you soon, Love Roman

Baby is an about 6 year old female Coonhound, Beagle, German Shepherd Dog mix. Baby is friendly but shy at first until she feels comfortable with new people and new surroundings. Baby knows a few commands but an obedience training class is always a good way for a new dog and new owner to get to know each other and develop a strong bond.  A fenced yard or several walks per day (be prepared to stop and smell everything along the way!!!) is what will keep Baby a happy dog along with lots of love and affection (of course).  If you would like to meet Baby and would like more information, please contact us through Petfinder or our website www.waifsandstraysrescue.org

Rudy is a happy, healthy, playful, about 12 year old Black Lab mix who is on the short side. Rudy loves people but is not good with young kids or cats (must be a no-cat household).  He knows sit, down, no bark and stay commands. He loves to sleep with his family at night if allowed.Rudy loves long walks and will be a great walking buddy. Rudy is neutered, microchipped, up to date on all immunizations and he comes with a free wellness exam with a veterinarian. If you would like more information and would like to meet this nice dog, please contact us through Petfinder or our website www.waifsandstraysrescue.org.

A DARLING 6-YEAR-YOUNG EX-PUPPY MILL DOG WHO NEEDS A "MOSTLY AT HOME"  OWNER, A QUIETER FAMILY AND A FENCED YARD.   THIS IS A  WONDERFUL, GENTLE AND LOVING COMPANION WHO WILL APPRECIATE EVERY ACT OF KINDNESS SHE RECEIVES.  TERRIER SAVVY FAMILIES WITH AN EXCELLENT TRACK-RECORD OF VETERINARY CARE ARE ENCOURAGED TO APPLY.

LILY IS LOCATED IN A PRIVATE FOSTER HOME IN PEORIA ILLINOIS (not Naperville).  WE WELCOME APPLICATIONS FROM OUTSIDE THE IMMEDIATE AREA AND PARTIAL TRANSPORT ASSISTANCE MAY BE AVAILABLE BUT ADOPTNG FAMILY MUST BE PREPARED TO DO SOME TRAVEL TOO.   
If you wish to apply to adopt Lily, you'll need to fill out our Adoption Application. To learn more about Cairn Rescue USA, please visit our website at www.cairnrescuieusa.com and please also review our FAQs.

6 year old Lily is a beautiful, affectionate Toto look-a-like who loves to cuddle and receive attention. 

Before coming into Cairn Rescue USA, Lily was a brood bitch in a breeding facility.  Like many breeder dogs who come from larger kennels, she lived in a cage with a concrete floor and never resided in a home.  Her exposure to humans was minimal and she was not socialized with toys or leashed walks as we expect to do with our pets. Simply put, she was used as livestock and her purpose in life was to produce puppies for profit. 

Today, Lily's life is quite different and she has grown by leaps and bounds.  She is  blossoming into a wonderful and happy young lady who responds to her name  and gives affectionate kisses.  

Lily's foster mom describes her as a girl with a great spirit!  She greatly enjoys the freedom of running in a fenced yard and playing with toys.  And for the first time in her 6 years she is sleeping on a soft bed and loves being pampered.

Lily is currently in a home with one other female Cairn who is ultra protective of her mom and demanding of attention so there have been a few altercations.  But Lily plays outside with a variety of visiting dogs and genuinely seems to enjoy canine companionship.   She would likely do very well with one other smaller, laid-back doggie pal.  She seems to do ok with cats.  too.   Lily CAN be food aggressive with other dogs, likely due to the fact that she had to fight for food in her previous life, so her future home will want to feed her separately from other household pets.

Although still a bit wary of loud noises and unknown situations, Lily is curious about her new world and is very eager to please. She wags her tail all the time now and shows true delight in interaction with kind humans. This little dog who previously had so little, is grateful for every act of kindness. 

In her past life as a breeder dog, Lily had no concept of when and where to go potty so when she came into our adoption program, house training started from the ground up.   But Lily has proven to be a fast learner and has made great strides in this area.  Today she rarely has pee accidents in the house and she holds it all night.  But pooping is still a work in progress so her future home will need to be patient and consistent as she fine-tunes her habits.  Warmer weather will certainly help her want to stay outside longer to finish the job.

Lily lies quietly in a crate but will not go in willingly. She much prefers being out and about with her people. At night she sleeps on a guest bed and would likely love to share a bed with her future parent.

LIly would be a wonderful companion for a retired gal or a quieter retired couple or even a work-from-home dog parent.   But she does need a home where there is an adult family member home for the majority of the day so that she can receive the  the time, love and structure that she so deserves.  At this stage, Lily has no concept of leashed walks and she MUST have a securely fenced yard (sorry, no electric fencing).  A home with an older child might be considered but Lily is not appropriate for an active home with lots of noise and commotion. 

Lily has been spayed and tested negative for heartworm disease. She is up-to-date on all her routine vaccination. She recently had a complete dental with seven extractions. Like many Cairns, she has some patella luxation and some stiffness in her legs but this in no way impedes her level of activity or her ability to run. Her future owner will want to keep her on a glucosamine/chondroitin supplement and monitor her weight to insure that she enjoys many more years of activity and health.

Milo is a super sweet three year old purebred Beagle who is looking for a new home because his family lost theirs and could not keep him and his 6 year old Beagle brother D-O-G.  The dogs do not have to be adopted together but two Beagles is better than one!  Milo was neutered, microchipped, given all of his immunizations on 1/21 so he is ready to go.  He comes with a free wellness exam with a veterinarian as well.  If you are interested in possibly adopting this good guy, please visit our website www.waifsandstraysrescue.org, fill out an application, email or fax it to us and we will be in touch asap.  You can also visit us on our Waifs & Strays Animal Rescue Facebook page and we hope you will "like" us.

D-O-G is a wonderful 6 year old male purebred Beagle who will make a fun addition to your household.  .  D-O-G and his brother Milo were given to us when their owners lost their house and could not keep them.  They lived in a family with kids age 6 to 16. on 1/21, D-O-G was neutered, microchipped, given all immunizations, and his adoption fee includes a free wellness exam with a veterinarian.  If you are interested in D-O-G, please visit our website www.waifsandstraysrescue.org, fill out an application, email it to us and we will be in touch asap.  You can also visit us on our Waifs & Strays Animal Rescue Facebook page and we hope you will "like" us.

Bubba is a handsome 2 yo Lab mix who is looking for his new forever family.  Bubba is a big strong guy and a little too much dog for his family with very young children.  Bubba is well mannered, likes other dogs and loves his cat.  He plays fetch and knows many commands.  Bubba was well loved and cared for and his family is sad to see him go.  If you are interested in Bubba, please visit our website www.waifsandstraysrescue.org, fill out an adoption application, email it to us and we will contact you ASAP.  We also invite you to visit us on our Waifs & Strays Animal Rescue Facebook page and we hope you "like" what you see.

Hi! My name is Dooney! No, I donât make designer purses with Bourke, but I am a pretty fashionable guy! Just look at my unique and adorable face! People think I am redbone coonhound/cur dog mix, but it doesnât really matter what my mix is because I am a terrific boy no matter what! My foster mom calls me a circus dog because I can dance on my hind legs for the longest time. I love doing it because it always makes her laugh. Another favorite activity of mine is to snuggle tight with my doggie brothers and sisters. I just love that companionship. I do have a nasty little secret thoughâ¦I like to snuggle tight and sometimes even chew on those other furry critters known as cats. I really donât mean them much harm, but they just run around teasing me all of the time! But if you are looking for a companion for yourself and your other doggies and are a cat-free home, I would be just the hound for you! 

His adoption fee is $200. For this, you get Dooney, who is up-to-date on vaccinations, spayed/neutered, and microchipped. If you have questions about me or the adoption process, please visit www.houndsong.com.

My name is Lily and I am an adorable 2.5yr old female Poodle-Terrier Mix. I am a whole 13lbs of very friendly, attention loving pup who is good with older children and adults. I am so excited about my new life that I am always checking things out, I do like to snuggle but for short periods of time as I am very curious about everything around me yet. I love runnin around in the yard chasing those squirrels and checking out the sites.. I would love to go for long walks or even a jog with you so I can see the world. I do not play with toys, I never had a toy in my life so I do not know what to do with one so maybe you can teach me how to pay with them? I just want my forever home and will be a good girl I promise. I am def a Poodle and have a Poodle coat that will need grooming as it does grow and there is no shedding. I am mixed with a possible terrier, my foster says I have terrier traits but we really do not know what I am a mix of but I can not gaurantee I am Hypo-Allergenic either just because I have Poodle in me. 
I do not like cats and can be selective about my dog friends especially other girl dogs, I want to be queen bee, it would be best if I was the only pup in the home. I am housebroken, crate trained and fully vetted, spayed, heartworm negative and Michrochipped to the rescue. 
 ****Please email for further information and with any questions.
Our adoption application is not located on any website or on our Facebook page. ****
I do have an adoption fee of $200 and that is to cover the cost of my vetting and to help save the next pup in need.Do you think you would be the right family for me? 
I am looking for my perfect home within 50 miles of Chicago Illinois
Our Adoption Process...
Adoption Application
Meet and Greet
Home visit
Adoption Contract
Adoption fee
*** Please be patient, we are a very small organization and we all sadly have to work and have families just like you. We also know the excitement of finding a pet that could be your furever family member and we receive numerous inquiries 
from other families who feel the same way. Our primary goal is matching the perfect family with our pups and do not practice first come, first serve". We are setting up many meet and greets with our pups and the family could be found prior to you even getting to meet them. We will make sure all potential adopters who inquired are updated if the pup has been adopted. We do not want to waste anyone's time and recommend you keep looking while you wait to hear from us and as always Thank You for adopting and not shopping. ***
Adoption applications will be sent via email only, we do not have them posted online anywhere or on a website.

My name is Ellie Mae and I am a cute and super sweet 5yr old little 48lb Beagle that is looking for my perfect family. I am so sweet I am just like sugar! I just love attention and will follow you around waiting for you to pet me and will sit in your lap to get it too! I get along great with most dogs and cats and like kids too! I use to suffer aniety issues and have not been tested alone for a long time so we are not sure how I owuld do alone or as an only pup in the home. I would love to be adopted with my loving sister Sassy. I would probable need someone who is home for long periods of time if I am adopted alone. I am housebroken and can go a long time so if you work I would do well as long as I get to go potty before you go to work. I lived in a home with a yard and love it but I does love walks too! I am not your typical Beagle where I bark and howl all the time but if someone comes to the door I'll let you know I have company coming in to see me. . I really love my sister Sassy and feel safe and comfy with her and I am not afraid when left home so that is why we would love to be adopted together but I can be adopted alone. I am crate trained but I don't need to be crate trained if it is found I am okay alone.
 She has had two families in her life.. her first family had her since she was a puppy for 1.5yrs and we do not know why she was given up. Her next family adopted both her and Sassy from two seperate locations but they have lived together since then, the family ran into a personal issue and could no longer care for both dogs and asked for help. Ellie Mae is crate trained but does not need to be crated. 
Ellie Mae is fully vetted, spayed, heartworm neg and microchipped.Otherwise Ellie Mae would need a home with someone home all day or with her sister and we are so low keyed we are perfect together! 
I am fully vetted/spayed/heartworm neg/microchipped
 Check out "My Story" for more information about me
 Ellie Mae and Sassy are both 5yr old sweet sweet girls looking for thier furever home together. Ellie Mae is a purebred Beagle has anxiety issues when alone and feels very comfy with her sister Sassy the Beagle/Dachshund around otherwise she would need a home with someone home all day. Both girls love people and attention and will seek it out. They are not your typical constant howling Beagles and love the yard they get to play in. Both girls would love to be adopted together and could use a tad bit of weight taken off which we are working on. Both are fully vetted/spayed/microchipped/heartworm tested
****Please email TheFirstStepRescue@sbcglobal.net for further information and with any questions and please state you saw our adoptable on Facebook. 
Our adoption application via "email" it is not located on any website or on our Facebook page. ****

My name is Sassy and I am a cute 5yr old little 35lbs Beagle Dachshund mix that is looking for my perfect family. I am so sweet I am just like sugar! I just love attention and will follow you around waiting for you to pet me. I get along great with most dogs and cats and like kids too! I am housebroken and can go a long time so if you work I would do well as long as I get to go potty before you go to work. I  lived in a home with a yard and love it but I does love walks too! I am not your typical Beagle where I bark and howl all the time but if someone comes to the door I'll let you know I have company coming in to see me. . I really love my sister Ellie Mae and feel I need to watch over her so that she doesn't get scared so that is why we would love to be adopted together but I can be adopted alone. I am also crate trained too.
She has had two families in her life.. her first family had her since she was a puppy for 1.5yrs and we do not know why she was given up. Her next family adopted both her and Ellie Mae from two seperate locations but they have lived together since then, the family ran into a personal issue and could no longer care for both dogs and asked for help. Sassy is crate trained but does not need to be crated. 
Sassy is fully vetted, spayed, heartworm neg and microchipped.Otherwise Ellie Mae would need a home with someone home all day and we are so low keyed we are perfect together! 
I am fully vetted/spayed/heartworm neg/microchipped
My Sisters Story:
(*** My name is Ellie Mae and I am a 5yr old purebred Beagle that is looking for my perfect furever home. I just love people and as soon as I meet you I follow you everywhere and just want to be touched, petted and loved. I have such a sweet sweet temperment it's so sweet it's like sugar! I get along great with most dogs and cats and I like children too! Sure I need a few pounds taken off and we are working on that but I am still a cutie! I do have anxiety issues but feel safe when I am with my sister Sassy the Beagle/Dachshund that I have lived with for a few years so I would love to be adopted with her so we can be very happy otherwise I would need a home where someone is home all day so I don't get scared and try and follow you out of the house ..***)
I have an adoption fee.. please ask..  to cover my vetting expenses and to help the next pup get saved down the road. 
I will only be adopted within 50 miles of Chicago Illinois 
Our Adoption Process...
Adoption Application
Meet and Greet
Home visit
Adoption Contract

*** Please be patient, we are a very small organization and we all sadly have to work and have families just like you. We also know the excitement of finding a pet that could be your furever family member and we receive numerous inquiries 
from other families who feel the same way. Our primary goal is matching the perfect family with our pups and do not practice first come, first serve. We will make sure all potential adopters who inquired are updated if the pup has been adopted. We do not want to waste anyone's time and recommend you keep looking while you wait to hear from us and as always Thank You for adopting and not shopping. ***

Hi my name is Gizmo and I am a 4yr 12lb male Pekingese Pomeranian mix that just loves and adores women above all else. I want to snuggle, sit in your lap and even sleep with you if I can. I do have a yard I love running around but I also love going for walks and seeing the sites. At the end of the day I am ready to snuggle and will jump in your lap, curl up next to you and the best thing is cozying right up to you in bed. 
I do have 8-10yr old children that visit my home who are dog savy and let me approach them, in fact they say hi but really don't come to see me so I do well with them. Children who may want to play, carry, tug, or give me kisses may or could make me nervous, I have not really been tested with younger children and with my inexperience with them I will only be placed in a home with children 15yrs and up. 
I get along great with my foster sisters and brother who are Dachshunds and smaller then me. I love to play with them and run around with them. We have a blast! I would love to have a furry companion as long as they are smaller then me, friendly and non-dominating. 
I do not like large breed dogs!! I think I am as big as them and go after them and forget them cats.. I can't live with them either. NO CATS!
I do have a long coat and will require brushing and I also shed a tad. 
I have been perfect with my potty training, I have had no accidents at all at home and have done no marking either and I am crate trained. 
I have been with my foster home for a while and do well in my home, I have someone home with me almost all day and yes I do bark, I do not know how I would be in an apt setting esp with barking, home alone for hours so I would best be adopted with someone who has a home or home a good portion of the day. 
I do have an adoption fee of $175 to cover my vetting and to help save the next pup.
I am fully Vetted/Nuetered/Microchipped/Heartworm Neg on preventative and also under flea/tick treatment as well
I am looking for my perfect home within 50 miles of Chicago Illinois an application and home visit a requirement
I am such a good little doggie!! Cute too!!
Our Adoption Process...

Hello!  My given name is Jasper, but my foster Mom calls me Jazz. I was given my name by the folks at GLWR, when they took me in. I came to the shelter after a kind person picked me up as a stray. I am an energetic, beautiful blue 3-4-year-old male. I am really lucky to have a landed myself a great foster gig and I am really doing well. I know basic commands such as sit, down and come, and I have good recall. I like to play fetch outside, no matter what the weather, and I will release the ball or toy when asked. I like to look for wildlife like squirrels, birds and mailmen from the windows, and I like to relax with a good bone. I am healthy, housebroken, and crate-trained.

I am a very affectionate dog who likes cuddling and curling up on the couch with my people. I play well with other dogs and get along fine with my Weim sister, Murphy.  

Before I moved into my foster home, I had a habit of hoarding things. That is, I was known to collect items that I thought were valuable and I would hide them in my crate! Since moving into my foster home, I have not exhibited this behavior at all.  However, I do have a tendency to resource guard. I like to be sole owner of my dog crate, and I consider it my personal retreat. Sometimes I bring dog toys in there to keep them safe. When I am in my crate, I do not really want to be bothered. For this reason, it may be best if I go to a home as an only dog and with no young children. It is important that my family is patient with me, and understands resource guarding and is willing to help me evolve beyond my insecurities.

I cannot wait to find a human or two, or more to call my own. I need someone who is willing to continue working with me on obedience, and who can provide plenty of exercise. I have an easy disposition, a fun-loving spirit, and I would really like to meet you!

Hi! I am Norah. I am a sweet little girl and only 1-2 years old. I am only about 10lbs but have LOTs of love to give! One of my favorite places to be is next to my people on the couch or their laps. I would make a great companion. I get along well with other dogs and even kids! If you are interested in adopting me please complete an application at www.digsk9.org.

**We do our best to accurately represent the breeds of each pet. However, the breeds listed have not been verified via a DNA test. They are chosen based on the appearance and characteristics of the pet at the time of listing.

My name is H.Winslow Brownwell ,of the Newport Brownwells but you can call me Winslow. From what I am told, I am such an amazing good boy!! I love everyone, including children, dogs, cats and FROGS!!! I tried to save one but he was afraid of me. I long to find a home in Illinois, I am a rescue dog from Mo, it's pretty bad when you are unwanted down there. My rescue angel TC made it her mission to send me to Grahamville. She says that if there is not an adopter up there right now that Grahamville will look for a great foster home!! If you would let me bunk with you a few days, I know I will find a home once my new family meets me!! I just need that chance, are you my chance? You can contact digsk9@gmail.com or complete a foster or adoption application at www.digsk9.org

Jinxey is a gorgeous, chocolate colorerd chihuahua boy that is about nine years old. He sure doesn't act his age. He gets so excited when you talk to him that he spins in circles--it's pretty cute. :). He has big, brown eyes and always has a smile on his face. He is a little guy and only weighs about 6.5 pounds. He is very friendly and loves meeting new people, big and small. He also does well with other dogs. He wouldn't mind a tasty bone to chew on if one is available, but is most happy chilling out and if you let him, he will curl up on the couch with you. Jinxey is a great little guy that deserves to be pampered in his golden years--would you be able to fulfill his wish? He is fully vetted, had his teeth cleaned and his adoption fee is $100 Go to www.digsk9.org and fill out an application today!

Meet Reno!! He is 7 months and almost 15 pounds. He is just the sweetest little guy and is looking for his forever home!! He is too little to be neutered but will come with a neuter cert at one of our approved vet clinics. You can complete an online application at www.digsk9.org -
 
**We do our best to accurately represent the breeds of each pet. However, the breeds listed have not been verified via a DNA test. They are chosen based on the appearance and characteristics of the pet at the time of listing.

My foster mom found me running the streets and lured me into her car with a doughnut, hence, my name...Munchkin. I had a wounds on my face and was underweight. It took me a while to heal, gain weight and get use to living this fancy life in a nice home with other dogs, toys, and lots of cuddles. Also, I'm in training (treats are my favorite thing so I'm really eager to learn, as I love the reward) and I'd say I'm an A+ student! I know I look serious, but I"m pocket pittie with soulful eyes and a fun, happy spirit. Take a chance on me and meet me. www.peaceforpitsrescue.org

!My name is Blue, and I am a 2 1/2 year old pit mix.  I am a
big friendly boy who loves other dogs and kids.

I love to go for my walks and am pretty agile for my size (about 90
pounds).  I enjoy hanging out on the couch and being part of a pack.
Who doesn't!

I know my basic commands, am crate trained and housebroken. 

I am such a good boy and all I want is to find my family, so we can
play, snuggle and spend our lives together. Could you be my family.

Gretel is an adorable little girl that was born on 11/23/2013. She is affectionate and playful and ready to find her forever home. If you are interested in adopting her, please complete an application at www.digsk9.org. The adoption fee is $350.00. She is current on vaccines, dewormed and comes with a spay certificate as she is too young to be spayed now.

**We do our best to accurately represent the breeds of each pet. However, the breeds listed have not been verified via a DNA test. They are chosen based on the appearance and characteristics of the pet at the time of listing.

I'm Dozer, and lets be honest, I am adorable. Look real close and you will see, you won't find another puppy quite like me.(that's right, I dabble in rap) I just turned 7 months old, so I am still a little wet behind the ears as they say, but I do know that every person that has gotten the pleasure to meet me has giggled like a school girl at a Justin Bieber concert. Plain and simple, I'm kind of a big deal. Fill out an application at www.peaceforpitsrescue.org today. If you snooze you will most likely lose.

Tator is a darling little boy around 2 years old and only 15lbs. He is friendly and good with other dogs. He loves his people and is quite the snuggler. If you are interested in giving this baby a forever home, please complete an online application at www.digsk9.org
